en.enableWorkspacesWizardBodyPart1: Securely manage user access and organize assets within your organization using workspaces. Implement granular access controls to streamline permission management and ensure efficient, secure access to resources. View assets and roles organization diagram.
en.enableWorkspacesWizardBodyPart2: Configure workspaces to fit your organizational structure. They can be structured in a hierarchy (parent-child relationships). Permissions assigned to a parent workspace are automatically inherited by its child workspaces, saving you configuration time. Learn more about workspace hierarchy and use cases for them in your organization.
en.enableWorkspacesWizardBodyPart3: Create user groups of both end users and service accounts. Tailor these groups to mirror your organization's structure. Explore predefined roles to see if they fit your needs. If not, create custom roles with specific permissions. Grant access to your workspaces. This connects roles and user groups to specific workspaces. These bindings determine who can access what, and the actions they're allowed to perform. Learn more about access management.
en.enableWorkspacesWizardCheckboxLabel: By checking this box, I acknowledge that this action cannot be undone.
en.enableWorkspacesWizardDesc: Enable "workspaces" for your organization to enhance access management (assets, roles, users, groups, etc.)
en.followingPermissionsCannotBeAdded: The following permissions can not be added to a custom role and were removed from the copied role:
en.granularPermissionsWillBeCopied: Only granular permissions will be copied into a custom role (for example, approval:requests:read). Wildcard permissions will not be copied into a custom role (for example, approval:*:read).
en.groupCreatedSuccessfully: You have successfully created a new group
en.groupDoesNotExist: Group with ID {id} does not exist.
en.groupNameTakenText: Please return to Step 1: Group information and choose a unique group name for your group.
en.groupsServiceCardDescription: Create user groups of both end-users and service accounts. Tailor these groups to mirror your organization's structure.
en.iamLearningResourcesLink: View all Identity and Access Management Learning Resources.

en.inviteUsersDescription: Invite users to create a Red Hat login with your organization. Your name will be included in the invite as a point of reference.
en.inviteUsersFormDownloadSoftwareUpdatesFi: User can download software and updates from the Red Hat Customer Portal.

en.inviteUsersFormEmailsFieldTitle: Enter the e-mail addresses of the users you would like to invite
en.inviteUsersFormIsAdminFieldDescription: The organization administrator role is the highest permission level with full access to content and features. This is the only role that can manage users.
en.inviteUsersFormManageSubscriptionsFieldD: Grants user access to subscription management via Red Hat Subscription Management in the Red Hat Customer Portal.
en.inviteUsersFormManageSubscriptionsViewAl: User can view (but not edit) all systems and Subscription Management Applications in the account.
User can view and edit only the systems that they have registered in the account.
en.inviteUsersFormManageSubscriptionsViewEd: User can view and edit all systems and Subscription Management Applications in the account.
User can view and edit only the systems that they have registered in the account.
en.inviteUsersFormManageSupportCasesFieldDe: The organization administrator role is the highest permission level with full access to content and features. This is the only role that can manage users.
en.inviteUsersMessageTitle: Send a message with the invite
en.name: Name
en.noAccountsInDefaultAccess: In adherence to security guidelines, service accounts are not automatically included in the default access group. To grant access, it is necessary to manually add them to the appropriate user access groups.
en.noAccountsInDefaultAdminAccess: In adherence to security guidelines, service accounts are not automatically included in the default admin access group. To grant access, it is necessary to manually add them to the appropriate user access groups.
en.noCostManagementPermissions: You are not entitled to add cost-management permissions to your role.
en.noGroupAccounts: There are no service accounts in this group
en.noGroupMembers: There are no members in this group
en.noGroupRoles: There are no roles in this group
en.noPermissionsForInsights: You do not have individual permissions for Insights.
en.noRbacPermissions: You are missing RBAC permissions to add inventory permissions to your role.
en.noResourceDefinitions: There are no resource definitions for {permission} permission
en.noRolePermissions: There are no permissions in this role
en.noWildcardPermissions: Wildcard permissions (for example, approval:*:*) aren’t included in this table and can’t be added to your custom role.
en.onlyGranularPermissions: Custom roles only support granular permissions
en.onlyGroupRolesVisible: This role list has been filtered to only show roles that are not currently in your group.
en.onlyNonUserGroupsVisible: This group list has been filtered to only show groups that the user is not currently a member of.
en.orgAdminHint: You can manage other users' permissions with 'User access'
en.orgAdminInheritedRoles: This group contains the roles that all org admin users inherit by default. The roles within this group are managed and maintained by Red Hat and cannot be edited.
en.overviewHeroListItem1: Control user access by organizing roles instead of assigning permissions individually to users
en.overviewHeroListItem2: Create groups that include roles and their corresponding permissions
en.overviewHeroListItem3: Assign users to these groups, allowing them to inherit the permissions associated with their group's roles
en.overviewHeroSubtitle: The Red Hat Hybrid Cloud Console uses role-based access control (RBAC).
en.overviewSubtitle: Streamline access management for your organization’s users and resources with the User Access to ensure secure and efficient control over permissions and authorization.
en.overviewSupportingFeaturesSubtitle1: The Default access group contains all authenticated users in your organization. These users automatically inherit a selection of predefined roles. The Default admin access group is limited to Organization Administrator users in your organization.
en.overviewSupportingFeaturesSubtitle2: If you need to modify the default access group to add or remove roles, this new group will change to a Custom default access group.
en.pageNotExists: Page you are looking for does not exist.
en.permissionNotDisplayedDescription: The permission either does not exist or has already been added to this role. Adjust your filters and try again. Note: Applications that only have wildcard permissions (for example, compliance:*:*) aren't included in this table and can't be added to your custom role.
en.permissionResourcesDetails: If there needs to be more details on the resources the permission is to be used for, it would be detailed here.
en.permissionStringDescription: The permission string is made up of the following inputs where it denotes which application and the resource type the permission will be allowed for.

en.whyNotSeeingAllPermissions: Why am I not seeing all of my permissions?
en.workspaceBillingAccountHelperText: The default billing account is based on the parent workspace's billing account. You can switch to a different billing account as needed. This change is independent of the workspace hierarchy.
en.workspaceDescriptionMaxLength: The first {count} characters will appear in the description field.
en.workspaceDetailsDescription: Complete the fields to create a workspace.
en.workspaceEmptyStateSubtitle: This filter criteria matches no workspaces.{br}Try changing your filter input.
en.workspaceNamingGuidelines: Use clear, descriptive workspace names like "Production North America" or "Project-X" to organize assets, control access, and simplify management.{link}
en.workspaceNotEmptyWarning: {count, plural, one {Workspace} other {Workspaces}} must be empty to delete and must not have any children workspaces. You must move assets in {count, plural, one {this workspace} other {these workspaces}} to other workspaces in order to proceed.
en.workspaceParentHelperText: This workspace will inherit access control settings, such as user groups and associated roles, from its parent workspace.
en.workspacesAccessDescription: Specify which workspaces you'd like to apply your selected permissions to, using the dropdowns below.
en.workspacesAlertTitle: You are qualified to opt into the workspace user access model for your organization.
en.workspacesLabel: Select workspaces to add permissions for
en.workspacesOverviewPageSubtitle: Workspaces let's you group related assets together (such as RHEL hosts). This simplifies management and user access control.
en.workspacesOverviewSubtitle: Securely manage user access and organize assets within your organization using workspaces. Implement granular access controls to streamline permission management and ensure efficient, secure access to resources. View assets and roles organization diagram.
en.workspacesServiceCardDescription: Configure workspaces to fit your organizational structure. They can be structured in a heirarchy (parent-child relationships). Permissions assigned to a parent workspace are automatically inherited by its child workspaces, saving you congfiguration time.
en.workspacesSubtitle: Workspaces provide a flexible, hierarchical, approach to organizing your assets and streamlining access management. Configure workspaces to fit your organizational structure.
en.workspacesSuccessAlertTitle: Your workspace migration is complete and ready to manage!
